controllers

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.GameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller class for GameScene. Runs through a game and then renders changes throughout the game to the view.
    Author:
    Josh Codd, Neil Woodhouse

      • GameController

        public GameController(Game game,
                      javafx.stage.Stage stage,
                      javafx.scene.media.MediaPlayer backgroundMusic)
        Constructs a GameController.
        Parameters:
        game - The game to be played.
        stage - The stage that this application is being displayed on.
        backgroundMusic - The audio to play in the background.

    • Method Detail

      • allowSelect

        private void allowSelect(Coord[] positions,
                         javafx.scene.Node node,
                         ActionTile action)
        Adds selectable ability to tiles, allowing an action tile to be placed on it.
        Parameters:
        action - The action tile to be played.
        node - The current tile being inspected.
        positions - The surrounding tiles of placement.

      • animateMove

        private void animateMove(Coord destination)
        Animates a player sprite as it moves from one tile to another.
        Parameters:
        destination - The Coordinate of the tile the player is moving to.

      • availableMoves

        private java.util.ArrayList<Coord> availableMoves(java.util.ArrayList<Coord> moves)
        Retrieves the available moves for a player.
        Parameters:
        moves - The game board valid moves for a player.
        Returns:
        The actual available moves for the player on this turn.

      • backtrackPlayer

        private void backtrackPlayer(Player player)
        Moves a player to their location two turns ago. If that tile is on fire then they are backtracked to 1 turn ago.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to be backtracked to an earlier position.

      • clearArrows

        private void clearArrows()
        Removes arrow buttons from around the game board.

      • drawActions

        private void drawActions()
        Draws action tiles that are currently placed the board, to the screen.

      • drawPlayers

        public void drawPlayers()
        Draws the players currently in the game to the scene at their current positions.

      • getArrow

        private javafx.scene.image.ImageView getArrow(java.lang.String direction,
                                              int index,
                                              int orientation)
        Retrieves the correct arrow 'button' for a specified side and row of the game board.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction that tiles should be inserted into to board.
        index - The row or column index of the arrow on the grid.
        orientation - The orientation that the arrow should be facing.
        Returns:
        An ImageView object of the arrow image, with correct on click behaviour.

      • getPlayer

        private javafx.scene.image.ImageView getPlayer(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane tile)
        Retrieves the player sprite for a player.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile that the player is standing on.
        Returns:
        The player sprite.

      • getRotationValue

        private double getRotationValue(int orientation)
        Gets the value to rotate the object by, depending at which orientation the object is currently set to.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The integer value representing the orientation of a tile.
        Returns:
        The rotation value of the tile (in degrees) (possible values: 0, 90, 180, 270).

      • getTileImage

        private javafx.scene.image.ImageView getTileImage(FloorTile tile)
        Retrieves the correct sprite for a given tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - The FloorTile object to fetch a sprite for.
        Returns:
        an ImageView object with the correct sprite rendering for the given tile, with correct on click behaviour.

      • getTilePane

        private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane getTilePane(int x,
                                                  int y)
        Retrieves the tile pane at a specified index of the board.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the tile.
        y - The y coordinate of the tile.
        Returns:
        The tile pane at that location.

      • handleActionClick

        private void handleActionClick()
        Plays the currently selected action tile.

      • handleContinue

        private void handleContinue()
        Handles the continue button click, progresses the game onto player movement.

      • handleDrawTile

        private void handleDrawTile()
        Produces a random tile from the silk bag of tiles, and displays on screen.

      • handleMenuClick

        private void handleMenuClick()
        Handles a click of the menu button, therefore showing and hiding the menu.

      • handleOrientationDecrement

        private void handleOrientationDecrement()
        Decrements the players current tile, rotating the tile anti-clockwise on screen.

      • handleOrientationIncrement

        private void handleOrientationIncrement()
        Increments the players current tile, rotating the tile clockwise on screen.

      • handleSaveClick

        private void handleSaveClick()
        Handles saving a game to file and the name that the file should be saved as. The player can either enter a string or use the default timestamp.

      • handleWinSaves

        private void handleWinSaves()
        For each player, their newly updated stats from this game are saved to their respective record.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        Initializes the Game and the Game GUI to be ready for start of game.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
        resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

      • isPlacementValid

        private boolean isPlacementValid(ActionTile action,
                                 Coord[] positions)
        Checks if its valid for an action tile to be placed at a position on the board.
        Parameters:
        action - The action tile to be played.
        positions - The surrounding tiles of placement.
        Returns:
        If the action placement is valid or not.

      • nextRound

        private void nextRound()
        Sets the game up for the next round of the game and checks if the player is the winner.

      • playActionToBoard

        private void playActionToBoard(ActionTile action)
        Sets all tiles on the game board to be selectable. Therefore allowing a player to place a action tile.
        Parameters:
        action - The action tile to be played.

      • saveGame

        private void saveGame(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves the games current state to file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name to save the game under.

      • selectBacktrack

        private void selectBacktrack()
        Makes players available to be selected to be backtracked to an earlier position.

      • setPlayerLabel

        private void setPlayerLabel(java.lang.String message)
        Set a message to displayed in the player label.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be displayed.

      • setTankSpin

        private void setTankSpin(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Sets the tank sprite of current player to rotate, following the mouse.
        Parameters:
        event - The event that triggered this method.

      • updateActionTileHand

        private void updateActionTileHand()
        Draws the action tiles that the current player has to screen.

      • updateArrows

        public void updateArrows(boolean visible)
        Draws buttons for inserting tiles at the ends of every row or column where the rows are not fixed. That is, there are no fixed tiles in that row or column.
        Parameters:
        visible - If the arrows should be visible or hidden.

      • updateGameBoard

        public void updateGameBoard()
        Updates the current game board GUI being displayed in the scene.

      • updateMoves

        private void updateMoves(java.util.ArrayList<Coord> moves)
        Updates tiles so that they are selectable and can be used for a player to move on to that tile. Tiles are only updated if that tile is a possible and legal move.
        Parameters:
        moves - The moves that are available to the current player.
